content: Anyone else having trouble installing the Anaconda Distribution on MacOS? I follow the prompts from the .pkg file, but I don't see an Anaconda Navigator on Launchpad like I'm supposed to.
subject: Installing Anaconda Distribution

content:
If you are still having trouble by Thursday, make sure to come to office hours ASAP so that an LA can help you resolve the issue.

According to the official documentation, it seems on M1 macs, Navigator is not automatically installed. It's probably fine to not install it, since it functions mostly as a "launcher" for Spyder and other applications. But if you want it, it should be as simple as running the terminal command to install (see the warning banner and the troubleshooting link).

https://docs.anaconda.com/anaconda/install/mac-os/
